intro: Ruellia rufescens, commonly known as redstem ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Ruellia rufescens is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and blooms. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade.
